Sentencas: Although biaxial flexure tests have been used extensively to measure the strength of brittle materials, the tests and analyses have been limited to materials of uniform properties.
Titulo: Recent advances in modeling stress distributions in multilayers subjected to biaxial flexure tests

Sentencas: Despite the increasing applications of multilayered structures, characterization of their strengths using biaxial flexure tests has been difficult because the analytical description of the strength-fracture load relation for multilayers subjected to biaxial flexure tests is unavailable.
Titulo: Recent advances in modeling stress distributions in multilayers subjected to biaxial flexure tests

Sentencas: The newly derived closed-form solutions for the elastic stress distributions in multilayered discs subjected to ring-on-ring tests are summarized here.
Titulo: Recent advances in modeling stress distributions in multilayers subjected to biaxial flexure tests

Sentencas: These solutions are obtained by (i) finding the correlation between monolayered and multilayered discs subjected to biaxial bending moment and (ii) conversion from the existing solutions for monolayers.
Titulo: Recent advances in modeling stress distributions in multilayers subjected to biaxial flexure tests

Sentencas: Using this methodology, the closed-form solutions for multilayers subjected to other biaxial flexure tests can also be obtained.
Titulo: Recent advances in modeling stress distributions in multilayers subjected to biaxial flexure tests

Sentencas: Finite element results for ring-on-rings tests performed on (i) porcelain/zirconia bilayered discs and (ii) solid oxide fuel cells trilayered discs are also presented to validate the closed-form solutions.
Titulo: Recent advances in modeling stress distributions in multilayers subjected to biaxial flexure tests

Sentencas: The closed-form solutions hence provide a basis for evaluating biaxial strength of multilayers using biaxial flexure tests.
Titulo: Recent advances in modeling stress distributions in multilayers subjected to biaxial flexure tests
